definition: lit. the birds are over, the bow is put away (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
surname Gong
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
storehouse/depository/Buddhist or Taoist scripture
Tibet/Xizang 西藏
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
lit. to boil the hound once it caught the rabbit (idiom)/fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
see 兔死狗烹[tu4 si3 gou3 peng1]
pinyin: jiao3 tu4 si3 zou3 gou3 peng1

definition: lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom)/to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful
lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
rebellious minister
Rear a tiger and court disaster. (idiom); fig. if you're too lenient with sb, he will damage you later/to cherish a snake in one's bosom
faithful official
rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
to usurp power
to seize the throne
being close to the sovereign can be as perilous as lying with a tiger (idiom)
to execute all of sb's relatives (as punishment) (old)
lit. to let the tiger return to the mountain; fig. to store up future calamities
the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
pinyin: tang2 lang2 bu3 chan2 , huang2 que4 zai4 hou4

definition: a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state
